The first step in this type of problem is to determine the amount of money that
must be available at the beginning of Year 4 (t = 3) in order to satisfy the payment
requirements. This amount is the PV of a 5-year annuity due at the beginning of Year
4 (end of Year 3). To determine this amount, set your calculator to the BGN mode,
enter the relevant data, and compute PV.
N = 5; I/Y = 10; PMT = -1,000; CPT + PV = PV; = $4,169.87
